definitions.example: History repeats itself if we don’t learn from its mistakes.

definitions.definition: The branch of knowledge that studies the past; the assessment of notable events.
definitions.example: He teaches history at the university.   History will not look kindly on these tyrants.   He dreams of an invention that will make history.

definitions.definition: A set of events involving an entity.
definitions.example: What is your medical history?   The family's history includes events best forgotten.

definitions.definition: A record or narrative description of past events.
definitions.example: I really enjoyed Shakespeare's tragedies more than his histories.

definitions.definition: A list of past and continuing medical conditions of an individual or family.
definitions.example: A personal medical history is required for the insurance policy.   He has a history of cancer in his family.

definitions.definition: A record of previous user events, especially of visited web pages in a browser.
definitions.example: I visited a great site yesterday but forgot the URL. Luckily, I didn't clear my history.

definitions.definition: Something that no longer exists or is no longer relevant.
definitions.example: I told him that if he doesn't get his act together, he's history.
He has had a lot of history with the police.
